etymology.description: semantic 广(廣) (guǎng, 'wide') + phonetic 黃(黃) (huáng, 'yellow') -> conveys the idea of a wide space or shelter
etymology.interpretation: 廣(廣) (guǎng, 'wide') represents the concept of an expansive area, while 黃(黃) (huáng) provides the phonetic component; together, they suggest a spacious shelter.
etymology.simplification: 广(廣): The character was simplified from several strokes depicting a house with a roof to its core element, resembling a house, for ease of writing.

examples.chinese: 大雨袭来时(大雨襲來時)，那家小店成了廣的庇护所(那家小店成了廣的庇護所)。
examples.pinyin: Dà yǔ xí lái shí, nà jiā xiǎo diàn chéng le guǎng de bìhù suǒ.
examples.english: When the heavy rain came, that small shop became a shelter.

examples.chinese: 大火蔓延之际(大火蔓延之際)，难民纷纷奔向廣的庇护所(難民紛紛奔向廣的庇護所)。
examples.pinyin: Dà huǒ màn yán zhī jì, nànmín fēnfēn bēn xiàng guǎng de bìhù suǒ.
examples.english: At the outbreak of the fire, refugees rushed towards the shelter.
